97643.name: Total tax (% of GDP) (OECD (2018))
97643.description:
The level of total tax revenues as a percentage of GDP. Total tax include sub-national revenues, and compulsory social security contributions paid to the general government. 

The tax-to-GDP ratio measures tax levels used in cross-country comparisons.

source.name: OECD (2018)
source.additionalInfo:
In 69 countries, the reporting year of tax revenue coincides with the calendar year, whereas 11 have different reporting years.  Where the GDP reporting year differs from the calendar year, annual GDP estimates are calculated by aggregating quarterly GDP estimates corresponding to each countryâ€™s fiscal (tax) year.

For further information on the OECD classification of taxes, see the OECD's Revenue Statistics Interpretative Guide (2017) available at: https://www.oecd.org/tax/tax-policy/oecd-classification-taxes-interpretative-guide.pdf
